title: 3 Ways to Change Your Address on Google

steps.title: Launch Google.
steps.content: Launch Google. Look for the Google app on your iOS device. It’s the one with the app icon with the “g” logo. Tap on it to launch it.

steps.title: Go to My stuff.
steps.content: Go to My stuff. Tap your profile picture on the upper left corner of the home screen. The Settings window will appear. If Google Now is turned off, tap on it to turn it on. Google Now needs to be enabled in order for you to access and change your addresses. Tap “Google Now” to enable, then tap “My stuff.” If Google Now is already enabled, just go ahead and tap “My stuff.”

steps.title: Change your address.
steps.content: Change your address. On the “My stuff” window, tap “Places.” You will see two fields, for Home and Work. Tap on the fields, and enter your home and work addresses, respectively.

steps.title: Save.
steps.content: Save. Tap “Done” button on the top right corner of the window to save. This will also exit the menu and direct you back to the Google home screen.

steps.title: Launch Google.
steps.content: Launch Google. Look for the Google app on your Android device. It’s the one with the app icon with the Google, or “g,” logo. Tap on it to launch it.

steps.title: Open the app menu.
steps.content: Open the app menu. Tap the button with three horizontal bars on the top left corner to access the app menu.

steps.title: Go to Places.
steps.content: Go to Places. Select “Customize” from here, then tap “Places.”

steps.title: Change address.
steps.content: Change address. On the Places window, you will see two fields, for Home and Work. Tap on the fields, and enter your home and work addresses, respectively.

steps.title: Save.
steps.content: Save. Tap “Done” button on the top right corner of the window to save. This will also exit the menu and direct you back to the Google home screen.

steps.title: Launch the web browser.
steps.content: Launch the web browser. Open any web browser on your computer. Your location or address isn’t dependent on any web browser.

steps.title: Do a search on Google.
steps.content: Do a search on Google. Go to Google and do a search. Type a search term or phrase in the search box in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Check your location.
steps.content: Check your location. On the results page, scroll to the bottom. The location or address Google used for your search is listed below the Google navigation pages.

steps.title: Update your location or address.
steps.content: Update your location or address. Right beside the location, click on “Use precise location” or “Update location” to automatically update your search results based on your current real location. Google will now use this updated location for your succeeding searches in your current session.
